content.prompt: Consider a 90 percent confidence interval for a population proportion p. Which of the following is a correct interpretation of the confidence level 90 percent?

choices.label: There is approximately a 90 percent chance that p is contained in the interval.
There is approximately a 90 percent chance that a randomly selected proportion p^ will be contained in the interval.
Approximately 90 percent of all possible sample proportions p^ will be contained in the interval.
In repeated samplings with the same sample size, approximately 90 percent of the intervals created will capture the population proportion p.
In repeated samplings with the same sample size, approximately 90 percent of the intervals created will capture the sample proportion p^.

topic.text: 6.3: Justifying a Claim Based on a Confidence Interval for a Population Proportion

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
